description:
When doing a live migration of an instance using ceph for shared storage, if the migration fails then the instance directory will not be cleaned up on the destination host. The next attempt to do the live migration will fail with DestinationDiskExists, but will cleanup the directory.

A simple way to test this is to setup a working system which allows a ceph instance to be live migrated, then delete the relevant ceph secret from libvirt on one of the hosts. Live migration to that host will fail, triggering this bug.
title: Live migration with ceph fails to cleanup instance directory on failure

    libvirt: Fix live migration failure cleanup on ceph
    
    _live_migration in the libvirt driver wasn't passing migrate_data to
    the cleanup function, which caused its behaviour to be defaulted based
    on the value of block_migration. These defaults are wrong for ceph,
    meaning that the instance directory was not cleaned up.
    
    This change ensures the libvirt driver always passes migrate_data to
    the cleanup callback. It updates the tests to assert this, and also
    that migrate data is passed to the post-success callback.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1430223
